article: One morning Raman, a true master of the art of archery , invited his favorite student to watch a display of his skill. The student had _ this more than a hundred times before, but he still obeyed his _ . Together, they went into a nearby wood and reached a tall _ . Raman picked a rose flower and _ it on one of the branches of the tree. He _ opened his bag and took out three objects: his _ , an arrow and a white handkerchief. Raman stood one hundred paces from the spot where he had placed the _ . Facing his target, he _ his student to blindfold him with the handkerchief. The student did as his teacher _ . "How often have you seen me practice the sport of archery?" Raman asked him _ . "Every day," replied his student. "And you have _ managed to hit the rose from three hundred paces away." With his eyes covered by the _ , Raman placed his feet firmly on the ground and drew back the bowstring with all his strength. Aiming at the rose on the _ , he let the arrow fly. The arrow whistled through the air, _ it did not even hit the tree, missing the target by a few meters. "Did I _ it?" said Raman, removing the handkerchief from his eyes. "No, you missed _ ," replied the student. "I thought you were going to _ me the power of thought and your ability to perform magic." "I have _ taught you the most important lesson about the power of thought." replied Raman. "When you _ something, concentrate only on that: No one will ever hit a target they cannot see."
